ratings.comment: Arbitrary grading, gave me an A- despite me doing every thing expected of me. Was not fun having class with her as she was very insensitive.

Prof Kjuchukova spent her last semester at this university teaching a class that she consistently referenced as boring. She missed multiple lectures unannounced, including two weeks right before the first midterm. Quiz, homework, and test grading was unclear and difficult, and she made threats to fail the whole class. Would not recommend.

Alexandra is a poor lecturer and is hard to find outside of class. She lectures at a quick pace and doesn't stop for questions or on difficult topics. She didn't seem to care much but when I had her, it was her last semester at the university. My biggest complaint was that she didn't give us useful review materials for exams.

She is a good professor for a proof-based course. She didn't curve anything, but she dropped the two lowest homework assignments and offered an extra credit assignment after the final. The tests were about half true/false and half free response. Kind of a strange sense of humor, but she is really personable.
Did a lot of proofs in class, and the tests were fairly difficult. Overall not a terrible teacher, definitely a quirky sense of humor.

Professor Kjuchukova really seemed to try and make an effort to be a good teacher and she tried to get laughs and be personable. I didn't think the class was too hard, but going to discussion is important, my TA really helped cement ideas down. The tests were really what she went over in lecture so the grading was clear.

She's an average math professor, her lectures are not so good but acceptable. (confusing sometimes but homework and TA would help you well) She gave lots of homework (difficult ones), no quizzes. Half of her exams are true/false proof questions, if you can do all of homework "all by yourself", you can do her exams.

She is a very nice professor, often willing to help and answer your questions in and out of class. However, almost half of each exam was composed of difficult proof-based true/false questions, which the other lectures did not have to know.

She gave a fair first exam that the class did well on, so she decided to give an impossible second midterm that was almost 50% tricky true/false with an emphasis on proofs for a class that is for majors looking for an applied course in linear algebra. She wasn't particularly inspiring, and always joked about how the class was boring. Disappointing.

She's not that bad at teaching, but just makes the tests unnecessarily hard. I know this because the other lecture was not nearly as difficult. No quizzes, but tons of graded homework. If you could take a different professor, I would recommend that. Also, she rarely does relevant examples in class
